This ruling will significantly impact how foreign funds structure their investments in India. The decision could redefine tax implications for indirect transfers and the validity of tax residency certificates. Investors are closely watching for clarity on tax rules and their potential impact on future investment decisions.

This initiative aims to support entrepreneurial journeys for vulnerable sections. The scheme will be launched in the next fiscal year, starting April 2026.

articles.title: Gems, jewellery exports dip 4.98% in December to $1,883.85 million: GJEPC
articles.summary: India's gem and jewellery exports saw a dip in December 2025. Geopolitical issues impacted demand in key markets. However, overall exports remained stable. Jewellery exports, especially gold and silver, showed strong growth. This balanced out a slowdown in cut and polished diamonds. Free Trade Agreements are boosting exports to countries like the UAE and Australia.

articles.title: India's textile exports maintain growth momentum in December despite tariff shocks
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports grew for the second month in December. This growth shows the sector's adaptability and strength in value-added products. Handicrafts, ready-made garments, and MMF yarn led the expansion. Exports remained stable for the full year. India's market presence broadened significantly across many countries, highlighting its position as a reliable global sourcing hub.

articles.title: Printing of Budget 2026 to take place at North Block, old address of finance ministry
articles.summary: Union Budget news: Budget document printing will continue at North Block. The finance ministry team has moved to Kartavya Bhawan. Printing of confidential Budget documents will remain at the old North Block press. This exercise involves staff quarantine for up to two weeks. The halwa ceremony marks the start of this quarantine. Union Budget 2026-27 will be unveiled on February 1.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: What India Inc wants from Sitharaman & Co amid tariff and trade pressures
articles.summary: As the Budget 2026 approaches, India is poised to become a global manufacturing hub amidst a structural reset in the world economy. Record FDI inflows signal growing confidence, while India Inc. shows resilient profit margins despite uncertain demand. The upcoming budget is crucial for deepening domestic capabilities and scaling India as a trusted manufacturing partner.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Make in India tops industry wish list amid execution worries
articles.summary: India Budget: Indian companies anticipate the Union Budget 2026 to prioritise domestic manufacturing and the 'Make in India' program. Industry stakeholders highlight high compliance burdens, logistics, and energy costs as major barriers. The budget is expected to focus on simpler tax systems, infrastructure development, and job creation to boost growth and unlock private investment.

articles.title: Budget 2026 key priorities: Skilling youth for an AI-ready future
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India, with about 65% of its population under 35, faces the twin challenge and opportunity of preparing nearly 950 million young people for a job market being reshaped by artificial intelligence. While AI is changing the scale and nature of entry-level jobs, it also offers new ways to deliver personalised, language-based learning at speed and scale.

articles.title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $191 million this week, down 51% on-year
articles.summary: Indian startups raised about $190.7 million in mid-January, sharply lower than a year ago but well above the previous week’s total. Funding activity also slowed, with fewer deals completed year on year. Healthcare, education and consumer brands led the biggest transactions during the week.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

This move is seen as a victory for child safety.

articles.title: Blinkit shows dark store distance on app after removing 10-minute delivery pledge
articles.summary: This development comes days after quick commerce companies removed 10-minute delivery pledges from their apps and other places after the government directed them to do so on Tuesday.

articles.title: CCPA fines Meta, Amazon, Flipkart, Meesho Rs 10 lakh each for illegal walkie-talkie sales

articles.title: Walmart International chief Kathryn McLay to step down after two years

McLay's departure comes two months after the Bentonville, Arkansas-based retailer announced that its CEO of 12 years, Doug McMillon, ​would be stepping down and succeeded by ​US division chief John Furner.

articles.title: Social media sites block 4.7 million underage accounts in Australia
articles.summary: Tech giants have blocked 4.7 million accounts under Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s, the country's online safety watchdog said Friday. "Given the vast number of online services and the fast-evolving nature of the tech industry, it's impossible to list all of the services which meet the conditions and are obliged to comply with the social media minimum age obligation," she said.

articles.title: VC firm Kairon Capital debuts with Rs 200 crore fund
articles.summary: Deepankur Malhotra, a former executive at Amazon India, where he focused on investing in consumer brands, has launched a consumer-focused venture capital firm, Kairon Capital, with a target corpus of Rs 200 crore, including a Rs 50-crore greenshoe option.

articles.title: Student loan companies feel the pressure of US visa squeeze
articles.summary: Education loans for studying abroad fell 30–50% in 2025, hit hardest by tighter US visa norms. Students are turning to Europe and smaller destinations, but loans are smaller and repayment risks higher. Lenders, especially NBFCs, are shifting focus to domestic programmes and alternative geographies to manage growth and risk.

articles.title: Trump imposes 25% tariff on imports of some AI chips
articles.summary: The proclamation follows a nine-month investigation under Section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 and targets a number of high-end semiconductors meeting certain performance benchmarks and devices containing them for import duties.

articles.title: India works to protect Chabahar Port after waiver ends
articles.summary: India is gearing up to unveil an innovative strategy for Chabahar Port, paving the way for strengthening its stake following the anticipated end of US sanctions in April. Collaborating with a regional Iranian firm, India Ports Global Limited aims to regain operational control over this crucial port.

articles.title: Cross-border e-commerce gets a legup, postal exports put on par with cargo shipments
articles.summary: Government reforms now treat postal e-commerce exports like regular cargo, enabling speedier clearances and access to key export incentives. These changes, effective January 15, address a procedural bottleneck, benefiting small sellers and e-commerce firms by streamlining processes and improving cash flow for digital-first exporters.

articles.title: Labour Codes may become effective from April 1
articles.summary: Sources said the ministry of labour and employment is considering making Labour Codes effective only from the next financial year (FY’27) to coincide with India Inc’s financial cycle as the change in salary structure under the Codes could result in higher outgo towards provident fund and gratuity, thus impacting the balance sheets of the companies.

articles.title: EPFO members can withdraw EPF money through UPI by April
articles.summary: EPFO members will soon withdraw provident fund directly to bank accounts using UPI. This new system aims for a secure and quick transfer of funds. The labour ministry is working to resolve software issues for a smooth rollout. This initiative will benefit around eight crore members, simplifying access to their EPF money for various needs.

articles.title: RBI raises Ombudsman compensation cap to Rs 30 lakh for banking customers
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has increased the compensation limit for customers to Rs 30 lakh for consequential losses and Rs 3 lakh for harassment, effective July 1, 2026. This move aims to provide meaningful relief to consumers while balancing the interests of regulated entities.

articles.title: Exports 'highly positive' in January so far: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India's exports are showing strong positive growth in January. This is happening even with global economic uncertainties. The Commerce and Industry Minister, Piyush Goyal, shared this optimistic outlook. Official figures for January exports and imports will be released on February 15. This follows December's merchandise export growth and a trade deficit.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves up by $392 million to $687.19 billion as of January 9
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a rise of $392 million, reaching $687.19 billion by January 9, 2026. This follows a significant drop in the previous week. Foreign currency assets decreased, while gold holdings increased. Special Drawing Rights and the country's position with the International Monetary Fund also saw minor declines.

articles.title: Live near a metro station? Your home loan may get easier
articles.summary: New research reveals metro station proximity positively impacts home loan EMIs by reducing transport costs and private vehicle reliance. This strengthens household balance sheets, improves financial discipline, and contributes to broader financial stability. The study highlights significant reductions in mortgage delinquency and increases in prepayments in metro-connected areas.

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki commences Victoris export, badged as 'Across'
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki has commenced exports of its mid-size SUV, Victoris, to global markets, with over 450 vehicles already shipped. The SUV, to be sold internationally as 'Across', will reach approximately 100 countries. This move aligns with the company's 'Make in India, Make for the World' vision, bolstering its position as India's leading passenger vehicle exporter.

articles.title: Quiet Repair, Real Power: How Budget 2026 can turn India’s demography into growth
articles.summary: India Budget: As the Union Budget approaches, the focus shifts to strengthening public finances and reshaping India's growth engine for durability and inclusivity. Recent policy boosts have supported consumption, but sustained income growth hinges on job creation, particularly in non-farm sectors. Budget 2026 has an opportunity to foster job-rich growth through targeted incentives for manufacturing and MSMEs, alongside addressing women's workforce participation.

articles.title: India's UPI miracle has a money problem; can Budget 2026 fix it?
articles.summary: Union Budget News: India's UPI digital payment system faces a crucial decision ahead of Budget 2026. While UPI has revolutionized transactions, its zero Merchant Discount Rate policy is straining payment companies and banks. Urgent action is needed to ensure the system's long-term viability and continued growth across the nation.

articles.title: India been a key driver of global growth: IMF spokesperson says as it looks to upgrade growth forecast soon
articles.summary: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to upgrade its India growth forecast for the upcoming World Economic Outlook in January. IMF spokesperson Julie Kozack highlighted India's robust economic growth, noting that third-quarter figures exceeded expectations. India is recognized as a significant engine for global economic expansion.

articles.title: 'One of the most promising crops': Mizoram CM Lalduhoma shares updates on state's big rubber plantation push
articles.summary: The Chief Minister said that the Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission was launched with the objective of transforming Mizoram into a major rubber-producing region.

articles.title: After 41-month high, Trump's tariffs drag India's export growth in December
articles.summary: India Export Data: India's trade deficit grew in December as exports slowed. Despite challenges, overall outbound shipments saw modest growth. Diversification strategies are deepening trade ties with West Asia, Europe, and other regions. Services exports also saw a contraction. Government initiatives are supporting exporters, with positive growth expected in goods and services trade for the fiscal year.

articles.title: India, Canada working to finalise scope for bilateral trade pact: Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: The two countries were earlier negotiating a trade pact but it was paused by Canada in 2023. Now they have decided to resume talks from the beginning as lot has changed on the global trade front during these two years.

articles.title: India, Israel see eye to eye on true vision for sustainable food security: Minister
articles.summary: Israel and India have signed a Letter of Intent to deepen cooperation in agriculture, fisheries, and the blue economy, aiming for sustainable food security. This expands their existing partnership to water agriculture, focusing on smart water management and innovation. The agreement underscores a shared vision and strengthens bilateral ties in these vital sectors.

articles.title: Gaudium IVF, Sillverton Industries among 7 IPOs approved by Sebi
articles.summary: India's capital markets regulator Sebi has approved seven Initial Public Offerings. articles.title: Wipro ADRs fall 6% as Q3 profit declines, deal activity goes down

articles.title: Sebi proposes to allow 'netting of funds' for FPIs in cash market to trim funding cost

articles.title: RVNL bags ₹88 crore South Eastern Railway order for IP-based video surveillance
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam (RVNL) won a ₹87.56 crore L1 order from South Eastern Railway to supply, install, and commission IP-based video surveillance systems in LHB coaches, to be executed over 10 months, with no related party involvement.

articles.title: HC restores NHAI decision to axe Delhi-Mumbai expressway contractor over delay
articles.summary: On January 13, a bench of justices Dinesh Mehta and Vinod Kumar set aside an order of a single judge of the high court restraining NHAI from acting on its December 23, 2025, "notice of intent to terminate" the contract of Roadway Solutions India Infra Ltd.

articles.title: Rahul to meet Indore water contamination victims, visit affected locality on Saturday
articles.summary: Gandhi will arrive in Indore on Saturday and meet affected persons undergoing treatment at Bombay Hospital, a private facility, he told reporters. The Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha would also visit Bhagirathpura and meet affected families to express condolences, he said.

articles.title: New labour code triggers ₹5,000-crore one-time hit for top IT firms

articles.title: Katrina Kaif’s Kay Beauty taps couture for global launch with Falguni Shane Peacock

articles.title: India remains engaged with US on conditional sanctions waiver for Chabahar Project: MEA

articles.title: SEBI Chairman dismisses FPI exit fears, says outflows cyclical; registration, netting reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said recent foreign portfolio investor outflows are cyclical and modest relative to the scale of overseas investments in India, while outlining upcoming reforms to speed up FPI registration, ease KYC frictions and introduce netting to improve market efficiency.

articles.title: Economists warn debt and geopolitics cloud fragile global recovery: WEF report
articles.summary: Global growth expectations have stabilised, but chief economists surveyed by the World Economic Forum warn that rising debt, narrowing fiscal space and shifting trade flows are creating new fault lines across economies.

articles.title: Economists flag AI stock froth, warn of crypto slide and weaker dollar: WEF report
articles.summary: Chief economists are divided on AI-driven equity valuations, warn of downside risks for cryptocurrencies, see mixed prospects for gold, and expect the US dollar to weaken, a WEF survey shows.

articles.title: SEBI chair drops hints on key market reforms coming soon

articles.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8% in December 2025
articles.summary: The overall Unemployment rate is estimated at 4.8% in December 2025 against 4.75% observed in November, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS).

articles.title: IMF's Georgieva backs Fed chair Powell, underscores importance of central bank independence

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet

articles.title: Budget 2026: Revamping auto PLI can unlock EV growth, says Deloitte India

articles.title: India needs inflation again: Why nominal GDP, not real growth, is the real Budget 2026 challenge

With inflation at multi-decade lows and nominal GDP losing momentum, policymakers face a new challenge: reviving revenues, earnings and debt dynamics in a world where disinflation may be structural rather than cyclical.

articles.title: Fix the tax collector, not the tax rate: Dhruva Advisors' Budget 2026 pitch
articles.summary: As the finance ministry readies Budget 2026, Dhruva Advisors has urged a decisive shift towards cleaner tax administration, calling for predictable interpretations, streamlined TDS rates, and a rethink of legacy mechanisms such as TCS. The firm argues that targeted tax incentives for AI, semiconductor manufacturing, and research are essential to improve investor confidence and lift India’s long-term innovation capacity.

articles.title: How AI can help Ujjwala deliver its next gains

articles.summary: The new tariff announcement also comes ahead of the Supreme Court ruling on whether or not Trump's tariffs even pass the legal framework. The Supreme Court has scheduled the next "opinion day" on Wednesday.

articles.title: Jindal Saw Q3 profit slumps 49% YoY; margins contract sharply

articles.title: What key arguments to include in reply to GST SCN under section 74 for denial
articles.summary: Section 74 applies only where fraud or intent to evade tax is established. Vague notices based on mismatches lack jurisdiction and are unsustainable. The post What key arguments to include in reply to GST SCN under section 74 for denial appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Unsecured Loan Addition Unsustainable Without Contrary Evidence
articles.summary: The issue was whether unsecured loans from directors routed through a partnership firm could be treated as unexplained cash credits. The Tribunal held that once identity, creditworthiness, and genuineness are proved through books and bank records, section 68 addition cannot survive. The post Unsecured Loan Addition Unsustainable Without Contrary Evidence appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Debatable MAT Computation Cannot Be Rectified Under Section 154
articles.summary: The issue was whether adjustment of brought-forward loss and depreciation under MAT could be altered through rectification. The Tribunal held that such MAT computation involves interpretation and debate, making section 154 inapplicable. The post Debatable MAT Computation Cannot Be Rectified Under Section 154 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Ex-Parte Appeal Dismissal Set Aside for Lack of Reasoned Order
articles.summary: The issue was whether the appellate authority could dismiss an appeal ex-parte without giving detailed reasons. The Tribunal held that a non-speaking order violates section 250(6) and restored the appeal for fresh adjudication. The post Ex-Parte Appeal Dismissal Set Aside for Lack of Reasoned Order appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed as JAO Lacked Jurisdiction After Faceless Scheme
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment notices could be issued by a jurisdictional officer after the faceless reassessment scheme became mandatory. The Tribunal held that such notices are void, rendering the entire reassessment unsustainable. The post Reassessment Quashed as JAO Lacked Jurisdiction After Faceless Scheme appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Appointment Denial Quashed for Ignoring Reasonable Accommodation
articles.summary: The Court examined whether procedural rigidity and expired panels could defeat disability rights. It held that denial of employment without reasonable accommodation violates constitutional guarantees and disability law. The post Appointment Denial Quashed for Ignoring Reasonable Accommodation appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 292B Cannot Cure Jurisdictional Defect in Reopening
articles.summary: The Assessing Officer assumed that no return of income was filed while recording reasons under section 147. The Tribunal ruled that such factually incorrect reasons vitiate the assumption of jurisdiction itself. The post Section 292B Cannot Cure Jurisdictional Defect in Reopening appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Property Purchase Addition Remanded Due to Unverified Agreement Date
articles.summary: The issue was whether stamp duty value on the agreement date could replace the registration-date value for section 56 additions. The Tribunal remanded the matter for verification of the claimed earlier payment. Key takeaway: benefit of the proviso depends on proving the agreement and payment date. The post Property Purchase Addition Remanded Due to Unverified Agreement Date appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Interest Disallowance Set Aside as Loan Found Genuine
articles.summary: Interest was disallowed treating the loan as bogus. Once the loan itself was held genuine, the Tribunal allowed the interest deduction. The ruling confirms that business interest cannot be denied without proof of sham transactions. The post Interest Disallowance Set Aside as Loan Found Genuine appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Search Assessments Quashed Due to Defective Section 153D Approval
articles.summary: The Tribunal examined whether a single approval could cover multiple assessment years in search cases. It held that separate approvals are mandatory for each year. The ruling underscores strict procedural compliance under section 153D. The post Search Assessments Quashed Due to Defective Section 153D Approval appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Purchase Addition Reduced as Manufacturing Reality Considered
articles.summary: Recognizing the nature of the manufacturing business and accepted sales, the Tribunal scaled down the disallowance. The decision stresses pragmatic assessment. articles.title: Waiting for a market crash may cost you more than investing at record highs
articles.summary: As markets hover near peaks, data across decades shows that long-term investors risk losing more money waiting for the perfect time to enter the market, than by staying invested through the highs and corrections.

articles.title: Why India's savings culture serves everyone except the saver
articles.summary: India’s love for fixed income isn’t just cultural—it’s structural. Banks and governments benefit, while savers quietly lose wealth to inflation, taxes, and time.

articles.title: Retiring early is looking more difficult. The new game plans.
articles.summary: A frothy stock market and looming inflation makes early retirement a trickier exercise.

articles.title: Verizon issues $20 credits to customers after massive outage: How to claim, when will you get it? — all FAQs answered
articles.summary: Verizon credit for outage: $20 credits issued to customers affected by massive outage caused by a ‘software issue’. The company acknowledged not meeting customer expectations and stated the credits would compensate for multiple days of service.

articles.title: Nothing confirms its first India flagship store in Bengaluru: All you need to know
articles.summary: Nothing has confirmed plans to open its first flagship store in India in Bengaluru. The upcoming outlet will offer hands-on access to its smartphones, earbuds and other devices, marking the brand’s second flagship store worldwide.

articles.title: iPhone 17e tipped to gain Dynamic Island but miss out on 120Hz display
articles.summary: Apple’s upcoming iPhone 17e is tipped to adopt the Dynamic Island design while retaining a 60Hz OLED display. Leaks also point to an A19 chip, possible MagSafe support and a familiar camera setup, with pricing expected to remain unchanged.

articles.title: Sony PlayStation Plus January 2026 adds Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
articles.summary: Sony has revealed the PS Plus Game Catalogue lineup for January 2026, confirming earlier leaks. Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth headline a strong mix of horror, RPG, racing and indie titles arriving on January 20 for Extra and Premium members.

articles.title: Apple may develop its own AI server chips, mass production tipped for later this year: Report
articles.summary: Apple may begin mass production of its own AI server chips later this year, signalling a deeper push into AI infrastructure. The move could allow the company to run artificial intelligence workloads on in-house data centres while continuing partnerships on core AI models.

articles.title: UK Weighs Australia-Style Social Media Ban for Children
articles.summary: The UK is considering following Australia in imposing a social media ban for children under 16 years old, amid growing calls for restrictions to protect vulnerable younger users.

articles.title: ​BGMI 4.2 update released: Royal Enfield bikes to Peaky Blinders crossover— Check all new features
articles.summary: Krafton India launched the BGMI 4.2 Update featuring a revamped competitive system, and new events. Players can now expect Royal Enfield bikes and Peaky Blinders characters in the game starting from 19 January. There is also a new Primewood Genesis theme mode in the game

articles.title: China Gets a Jump on Trying AI Everywhere From Cars to Birdbaths
articles.summary: Amid the keynote speeches and product unveilings at CES this month, the Las Vegas electronics trade show delivered an important geopolitical message: Chinese companies are rapidly embedding artificial intelligence into a sprawling range of real-world products, taking the AI rivalry between Washington and Beijing from chatbots and image generators into the realm of robots, automobiles and consumer products.

articles.title: Google makes Gemini ‘proactive and powerful’ with Personal Intelligence: here's how it works
articles.summary: Google's Gemini chatbot introduces Personal Intelligence, enhancing user experience by linking with Google apps like Gmail and Photos.The feature is currently in beta and enables users to get tailored responses and proactive suggestions from the chatbot.

articles.summary: Verizon outage disrupts calling and data services for wireless customers across the US

articles.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 could finally match Plus and Ultra models in charging speed: Report
articles.summary: Expected to launch in February, the Samsung Galaxy S26 may include 45W charging, a notable enhancement from the previous model's 25W. While the battery and camera specs could remain unchanged, the device is expected to follow a dual chipset strategy for different models.

articles.title: YouTube introduces new parental controls and limits on Shorts for teens: How it works
articles.summary: YouTube has introduced new tools for families, including limits on Shorts viewing, clearer guidance on quality teen content, and a simplified account setup, aiming to give parents more control over how children and teenagers use the platform. Here's everything you need to know on the policy changes.

articles.title: Elon Musk pushes back against Grok AI image abuse claims, ‘It will refuse to produce anything illegal’
articles.summary: Elon Musk has dismissed allegations that Grok produces illegal images of minors, saying the AI only responds to user prompts and refuses unlawful requests, while acknowledging that rare misuse attempts are treated as bugs and fixed promptly.

articles.title: Google opens access to AI models for medical imaging and speech, unveils MedGemma 1.5 and MedASR: All you need to know
articles.summary: Google has launched MedGemma 1.5 and MedASR, two open AI models for healthcare research. The tools focus on analysing medical images and transcribing clinical speech, offering researchers and developers flexible, community-driven medical AI solutions.

articles.title: Free Starlink access for Iran seen as game changer for demonstrators getting their message out
articles.summary: Free Starlink access for Iran seen as game changer for demonstrators getting their message out

articles.title: Google adds vertical video support to Veo 3.1 for shorts and reels: How it works
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its Veo 3.1 AI model on Tuesday with better video generation, improved prompt understanding, stronger character consistency, and native vertical video support for Shorts, Reels, and TikTok, along with enhanced 1080p quality and 4K upscaling.

articles.title: Apple introduces Creator Studio Subscription for video, music and design professionals: How much it costs
articles.summary: Apple Creator Studio brings Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro and Pixelmator Pro into one subscription, adding AI-powered video, music and design tools for Mac and iPad, with premium content and student pricing, available from January 28.

articles.title: Britain seeks reset in copyright battle between AI and creators
articles.summary: BRITAIN-TECH-AI-COPYRIGHT:Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators

articles.title: New Delhi to evacuate Indian nationals from Iran amid escalating protests
articles.summary: This comes a day after MEA advised Indian nationals to leave Iran by any available means of transport as the situation in the West Asian country continued to spiral.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit with China widens as Beijing hits record $1.2tn trade surplus despite Trump tariffs
articles.summary: China’s exports to India have grown by 13.46 per cent between the first nine months of the 2024-2025 financial year and the 2025-26 financial year, according to the latest trade data.

articles.title: India-China & ASEAN should come together for Panchsheel 2.0, says former Singapore FM
articles.summary: George Yeo was speaking at the 43rd CD Deshmukh Memorial Lecture in Delhi where he spoke about the importance of India-China ties in the Trump era.

articles.summary: As Sergio Gor presents credentials to the President, India has a new US ambassador, a year after Biden appointee Eric Garcetti vacated the post on 19 January 2025.

articles.title: As India protests infra buildup, China reasserts claim over Shaksgam Valley. ‘It’s fully Chinese’
articles.summary: New Delhi has never recognised the so-called China-Pakistan ‘Boundary Agreement’ signed in 1963, through which Islamabad ceded territorial control of the valley to Beijing.

articles.summary: At launch of his latest book, Congress MP asserts that weaponisation of social media led to regime change in neighbouring countries but nobody has gone into the grievances.

articles.summary: Next call on trade between the two sides to occur Tuesday, says the ambassador-designate who arrived in India Friday   is set to present his credentials to the President Wednesday.

articles.title: UAE blocks scholarships to UK over radicalisation fears. Muslim Brotherhood is key to the concern
articles.summary: UAE’s move reportedly comes after London failed to proscribe the Islamist organisation. Muslim Brotherhood has been proscribed across West Asia, but remains active in Europe.

articles.title: Bangladesh’s biggest public university to rename Sheikh Mujib hall after slain student leader Osman Hadi
articles.summary: The move follows multiple references of Bangladesh’s founding father being removed from textbooks to infrastructures and now campus halls.

articles.title: BBC to strike content deal with YouTube, FT reports
articles.summary: The ‍BBC plans ​to produce programmes ⁠for YouTube for the first time, marking a ‌major ‌strategic shift as it ‌seeks to recapture audiences moving to US tech platforms.

articles.title: Meet the new Indian-origin CTO of Mira Murati’s Thinking Machines
articles.summary: Hyderabad-born Chintala, who joined Thinking Machines Lab in November 2025, will replace Barret Zoph who stepped down as CTO. Announcing his appointment, Murati described Chintala as “a brilliant and seasoned leader who has made important contributions to the AI field for over a decade” in a post on microblogging platform X.

articles.title: X revises developer API policies, bans ‘InfoFi’ apps to tackle bot spam
articles.summary: Confirming the development, X’s head of product Nikita Bier said apps that financially reward users for posting on X will no longer be permitted under the platform’s API terms.

articles.title: India warns Apple it will proceed with antitrust case after company plays for time
articles.summary: India has issued a final warning to Apple regarding an antitrust case. The Competition Commission of India stated that Apple has delayed responses for over a year. This has undermined the investigation. Apple fears a potential fine of up to $38 billion. The company has challenged penalty rules in court. The CCI rejected Apple's request to pause the case.

articles.title: Amazon expands 'sovereign cloud' in Europe
articles.summary: Amazon's cloud computing division said Thursday that it would expand its "sovereign cloud" across the European Union, hoping to cash in as EU governments seek to safeguard their citizens' data.

articles.title: Quick commerce riders unaware that 10-minute delivery claim has been removed
articles.summary: A day after quick commerce companies revamped their apps to remove the 10-minute delivery claim, the gig workers at the centre of this issue remain unaware of the developments. Quick commerce majors have been repeatedly saying that delivery timelines are not displayed to last-mile workers and they are not penalised for delays. However, delivery partners said that consumers still expect their orders to get delivered within 10-minutes.

articles.title: Taiwan computer chipmaker TSMC's to expand investment as profit jumps 35%
articles.summary: Taiwan's TSMC, a top chipmaker, will boost spending by nearly 40 percent this year. This move follows a 35 percent profit jump fueled by artificial intelligence demand. TSMC is investing heavily in advanced chip manufacturing. The company expects continued strong demand for its leading-edge technologies.

articles.title: UK PM says X must make Grok changes 'immediately'
articles.summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday said measures announced by Elon Musk's platform X to prevent its AI chatbot Grok from undressing images of real people "must happen immediately".

articles.title: Reasons to believe Russia behind cyberattack on Polish power system, PM says
articles.summary: Poland suffered its biggest cyberattack on the power system in years in late December, but defences stopped any serious damage. Prime Minister Donald Tusk said there are strong reasons to link the attack to groups tied to Russian intelligence services. He stressed Poland’s infrastructure was never at risk and safe.

articles.title: AI startups to focus on turning pilots into scalable products: Google India country manager Lobana
articles.summary: AI startups need to focus on converting pilots to full-fledged products that can scale and generate revenues, said Google India vice president and country manager Preeti Lobana.

articles.title: Wikipedia owner signs on Microsoft, Meta in AI content training deals
articles.summary: Wikimedia Foundation, the operator of the online encyclopedia, said it also signed on AI startup Perplexity and France's Mistral AI, among other firms, over the past year, having ‌enlisted Meta and ‌Amazon as partners previously.

articles.title: Amazon launches new Europe-based cloud service to address user concerns
articles.summary: The AWS European Sovereign Cloud's data centres are physically and legally separate from the U.S.-based company's other servers, the world's ‌largest cloud ‌provider said.

articles.title: TSMC fourth-quarter profit leaps to record driven by AI boom
articles.summary: Benefiting ‌from surging demand for advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co said net profit for October-December climbed to T$505.7 billion ($16 billion), its seventh straight quarter of double-digit ​growth.

articles.title: Microsoft in record deal for soil carbon credits as data centres surge
articles.summary: While Microsoft - the world's biggest buyer of carbon removal credits - did not disclose the cost of the 12-year tie-up, a person with knowledge of the deal said ‌it falls within ‌the historic range of $60 to $80 a ton for Indigo Carbon's credits, which would value the deal at between $171 million and $228 ‌million.

articles.title: Key researchers return to OpenAI from former CTO Mira Murati's Thinking Labs
articles.summary: Barret Zoph, Luke Metz, and Sam Schoenholz have officially rejoined the company, following a brief stint at former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati's artificial intelligence (AI) startup. The return of the trio is good news for the Sam Altman-led company, which was hit by multiple departures last year amid an intensifying war for talent in the AI space.

articles.title: PM Modi to attend National Startup Day event, interact with members of startup ecosystem
articles.summary: Startup India was launched on January 16, 2016, as a transformative national programme to nurture innovation, promote entrepreneurship and enable investment-driven growth, with the objective of making India a nation of job creators rather than job seekers.

articles.title: Google announces Personal Intelligence feature in Gemini
articles.summary: This new mode will allow Gemini to securely connect with a person's Gmail, YouTube, Google Photos, and Search to offer responses that are hyper-relevant to their life.

articles.title: Musk's X announces measures to bar Grok from undressing images after global backlash
articles.summary: Elon Musk's platform X on Wednesday announced measures to prevent its AI chatbot Grok from undressing images of real people, following global backlash over its generation of sexualized photos of women and children. The announcement comes after California's attorney general launched an investigation into Musk's xAI -- the developer of Grok -- over the sexually explicit material and multiple countries either blocked access to the chatbot or launched their own probes.

articles.title: Trump embraces AI deepfakes in political messaging
articles.summary: From playing football in the Oval Office to sipping cocktails on a sun lounger in Gaza and attacking critics from a fighter jet, Donald Trump has become the first US president to deploy AI-generated imagery as a key tool of political communications. "While it would in many ways be desirable for the president to stay above the fray and away from sharing AI-generated images, Trump has repeatedly demonstrated that he sees his time in office as a nonstop political campaign," Joshua Tucker, co-direct

articles.title: Alibaba upgrades Qwen app to order food, book travel
articles.summary: The new features, now in public testing in China, enable users to complete such tasks entirely within ‌the AI chat interface, ‌without switching between applications.

articles.title: California to investigate xAI over Grok chatbot images, officials say
articles.summary: Early ​this year, hyper-realistic images of women processed to look like they were in microscopic bikinis, ‌in degrading poses, or ‍covered in bruises flooded X, the site formerly known as Twitter. In ‍some cases, minors were digitally stripped down to swimwear.

articles.title: Google says US transmission system is biggest challenge for connecting data centers
articles.summary: The world's largest technology companies are running up against the realities ‌of the ‌country's slow-moving power system as they race to access vast amounts of electricity for the expansion of energy-intensive ‌data centers, which are increasingly being used to train and roll out artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Smaller cities beating many congested state capitals in GCC race
articles.summary: From Karnataka’s coastal belt to West Bengal’s rust belt, founders and technology leaders say smaller cities are increasingly outcompeting congested state capitals for deep-tech, AI and R D work. In Karnataka, founders and CTOs who built for global markets from the coastal tier-2 city of Mangaluru are now doubling down on it as a serious alternative to Bengaluru for deep-tech, gaming and legal-tech work.

articles.title: Walmart's Flipkart, Swiggy drop 10-minute delivery claim in India
articles.summary: Several Indian quick commerce firms, including Flipkart, Swiggy, Zepto, and Blinkit, have stopped advertising "10-minute" grocery delivery after the government raised road safety concerns. The services themselves remain, with fast deliveries still possible in many areas. Experts say the change mainly affects marketing, not the actual business model.

articles.title: EU will carefully assess X's promised changes to Grok, spokesperson says
articles.summary: The European Commission will review changes Elon Musk’s platform X plans for its Grok chatbot. The updates aim to stop Grok from producing sexualised images of women and children. If the measures prove insufficient, the Commission warned it could take full action under the Digital Services Act.

articles.title: Oracle sued by bondholders over losses tied to AI buildout
articles.summary: Bondholders have filed a lawsuit against Oracle, claiming they lost money. They allege the company, led by Larry Ellison, did not reveal it needed to sell more debt to expand its AI systems. The New York court case involves $18 billion in bonds issued in September, with Ellison and the banks also named.

articles.title: YouTube launches new updates to tailor viewing experience for teens
articles.summary: YouTube on Wednesday said it had launched a few updates to help parents tailor their family’s YouTube experience, especially for teen viewers. These included additional controls for mindful viewing like custom bedtime and take a break reminders, a blueprint for high quality teen content and curating the right experience for the appropriate age.

articles.title: Battle over Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia rages in Dutch court
articles.summary: A Dutch court is considering whether to investigate a Chinese-owned semiconductor firm amid tensions between the Netherlands and China over control, governance, and national security, with a ruling expected within weeks.

articles.title: Foxconn, HCL Group name semiconductor JV as India Chip Pvt Ltd
articles.summary: Electronics manufacturing services giant Foxconn and HCL Group have named their semiconductor joint venture as India Chip Private Limited, a regulatory filing said on Wednesday.

articles.title: India, Germany sign telecom pact as PM Modi–Chancellor Merz push for digital cooperation
articles.summary: India and Germany have signed a Joint Declaration of Intent on Telecommunications Cooperation, aiming to deepen collaboration in emerging digital technologies, policy frameworks, and manufacturing. This agreement, a key outcome of Prime Minister Modi's meeting with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, establishes a framework for regular consultations and joint efforts to foster inclusive and sustainable digital transformation.

articles.title: India-US talks on 'virtually', trade deal near finish line
articles.summary: In the last week of December, commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal had a virtual meeting with US trade representative Jamieson Greer.

articles.title: Urban mobility infra strengthened household finances: EAC-PM
articles.summary: According to the paper, investments in urban mobility infrastructure over the past decade, particularly metro rail expansion, have translated into stronger household liquidity management and more disciplined borrowing.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 4.8% in December
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in December, reaching 4.8 percent from 4.7 percent in November. This rise was driven by joblessness in urban areas, while rural unemployment remained steady. The overall jobless rate for men and women also edged up. Youth unemployment experienced a small increase.

articles.title: Textiles & apparel exports fall in first three quarters of FY26
articles.summary: Indian textile and apparel exports saw a slight dip in the first nine months of FY26. Textile shipments declined, while apparel exports showed growth. Restrictions in Bangladesh and market uncertainties in the US impacted yarn and fabric sales. Some exporters offered discounts to maintain sales volumes. Companies heavily reliant on the US for home textiles faced significant challenges.

articles.title: Expecting India's 2025-26 overall exports to touch USD 850 billion: Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: India is projected to surpass USD 850 billion in total exports for FY 2025-26, building on a strong performance in both merchandise and services. For the first nine months of the fiscal year, overall exports reached USD 634.26 billion, a 4.33% increase from the previous year. The services sector continues to be the primary driver of this growth.

articles.title: Awaiting clarity on US' proposed Iran-related tariffs: Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: Trump, in a social media post on Monday, said "effective immediately", any country doing business with Iran will pay a tariff of 25 per cent on any and all business being done with the US.

articles.title: Budget 2026-27: High compliance burden, limited access to capital drag manufacturing growth, as per survey
articles.summary: Business leaders have urged the government to take measures to boost domestic manufacturing and strengthen the 'Make in India' initiative in the Budget 2026-27.

articles.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8 pc in December
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 and above saw a slight increase to 4.8% in December 2025 from 4.7% in November. While rural unemployment remained stable, urban unemployment rose. The Worker Population Ratio and Labour Force Participation Rate showed a marginal upward trend overall.

articles.title: NITI Aayog proposes convergence of MSME scheme to enhance efficiency
articles.summary: NITI Aayog has proposed converging similar MSME schemes across ministries for smoother implementation and greater efficiency. A centralized portal and coordinated skill development framework are suggested to enhance scheme impact and beneficiary mobilization. However, caution is advised for schemes targeting specific groups or large flagship programs.

articles.title: India's December goods exports up 1.86%, US exports holding well
articles.summary: The US, UAE and China were top three export destinations in April -December FY26. Goods exports to China were up 36.68% on-year and to the US up 9.75% in the first nine months of the fiscal.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit widens to to $25.04 billion in December after five-month low in November
articles.summary: India’s merchandise trade deficit widened to $25.04 ‌billion in December, reversing the decline seen in November when the gap had fallen to a five-month low of $24.53 billion, government data showed.

articles.title: India’s Budget 2026 to support new and strategic ambitions
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India's FY27 Union Budget is poised to prioritise strategic sectors like defence, semiconductors, and renewables, alongside expanding 'new economy' roles. Expect higher capital expenditure on infrastructure and a focus on supply-side reforms to attract investment. The budget will also address governance issues through deregulation and support for domestic priority sectors, aiming to strengthen human capital and manage the fiscal deficit.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Agri sector pitches for tech push, climate-smart infrastructure
articles.summary: With the Budget 2026 on the horizon, leaders in the agriculture sector are rallying for a substantial increase in investments directed towards digital infrastructure, climate-smart practices, and technological advancements. They argue that these enhancements are crucial for elevating productivity levels and generating new job opportunities.

articles.title: If Iran falls, India may also have something to worry about
articles.summary: India Iran relations face renewed scrutiny as protests in Tehran threaten New Delhi’s access to Central Asia via Chabahar Port. Instability could weaken Iran as a counterweight to Pakistan and extremist groups, while giving China greater regional influence.

articles.title: Budget 2026 and India’s bid for a rare earths power shift
articles.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations: India is treating rare earths as a key strategic test case to loosen China’s grip on the sector, with the focus sharpening ahead of Budget 2026. Experts say the budget must prioritise de-risking private investment—through easier financing, tax incentives and assured offtake agreements—to scale up mining, processing and downstream manufacturing. The push is seen as critical to meeting India’s infrastructure build-out and energy transition goals.

articles.title: Hong Kong emerges key market for India's high-value exports
articles.summary: India's exports to Hong Kong are surging. Shipments of silver jewellery, electronics, and processed stones have seen substantial growth. Cut and polished diamonds are leading this increase. This trend highlights Hong Kong's growing importance as a trading hub for India. Diversification of exports is a key factor. Electronics and silver jewellery exports have more than doubled.

articles.title: Wholesale inflation hits 8-month high of 0.8% in December
articles.summary: Wholesale prices have exited deflation. Inflation reached an eight-month high of 0.83% in December. This shift was driven by stable food prices and rising costs for manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw an increase. Experts note base effects and stable prices contributed to the wholesale inflation rate. The commerce ministry highlighted increases in various manufacturing sectors.

articles.title: New forex risk capital rules from April 2027
articles.summary: RBI has proposed significant changes to how banks manage their foreign exchange exposure. These updates aim to align Indian regulations with global Basel standards, simplifying calculations by merging offshore and onshore positions. The move also includes treating gold separately and exempting certain structural forex holdings, ensuring consistent application across all financial institutions.

articles.title: Vijay Kedia buys stake in smallcap SPML Infra via bulk deal
articles.summary: Ace investor Vijay Kedia has acquired a stake in SPML Infra. Kedia Securities bought over 14 lakh shares for approximately Rs 25 crore. SPML Infra is a smallcap infrastructure firm with expertise in power, water, and environment sectors. The company has a strong track record of executing projects across India.

articles.title: Buy gold, sell Bitcoin: Jefferies' Chris Wood explains his big bet of 2026
articles.summary: Jefferies strategist Christopher Wood is selling Bitcoin and shifting to physical gold, citing quantum computing risks to Bitcoin’s cryptography. Accelerating quantum timelines undermine digital assets’ long-term store-of-value case, prompting portfolio reallocation toward gold and mining stocks for resilience globally today.

articles.title: Trump's greenlight for Nvidia AI chips to China draws fire from lawmakers, former officials
articles.summary: US lawmakers ​and former officials on Wednesday questioned President Donald Trump's decision to allow Nvidia to sell its second ⁠most powerful AI chips in China, arguing the move erodes America's AI edge and threatens to electrify Beijing's military.

articles.title: Flipkart to launch SLAP, its conversational AI shopping assistant
articles.summary: Flipkart will launch its new AI shopping assistant, Shop Like a Pro (SLAP), next week as a standalone app, replacing its earlier assistant, Flippi. SLAP will provide personalised recommendations, product suggestions, and answer customer queries. The move follows growing use of AI in ecommerce by Amazon, Walmart, and Google.

articles.title: AI risks 'mass unemployment' in London: Mayor
articles.summary: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has issued a stark warning about artificial intelligence potentially causing mass unemployment in the UK capital. He will outline both the risks and benefits of AI in a speech.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: Lakshmi Mittal’s father Mohan Lal Mittal passes away at 99
articles.summary: Mohan Lal Mittal, father of Lakshmi Mittal, passed away at 99 in London. Narendra Modi praised his industrial legacy, philanthropy, and dedication to family and Indian culture.

articles.title: Tech hiring set to rise 12-15% in 2026: Adecco India
articles.summary: Overall tech hiring across permanent, temporary and contractual roles is set to rise 12-15% in 2026, adding nearly 1,25,000 new jobs as expansion continues across segments, according to workforce solutions provider Adecco India.

articles.title: Difference between hedging and speculation in derivatives
articles.summary: Derivatives like futures, options, swaps, and forwards help investors hedge risks or speculate for profit in financial markets, with hedging focused on protection and speculation on gains.

articles.title: US announces trade deal with Taiwan, cuts tariff to 15% in exchange of $250 billion investment
articles.summary: In response, the US has capped tariffs on Taiwanese auto parts, timber, lumber and wood derivative products at 15%. Generic Pharma and ingredients manufactured in Taiwan will attract zero tariff, according to the Commerce Ministry statement.

articles.title: India’s National Statistical Commission at a crossroads
articles.summary: The Parliamentary Standing Committee flags gaps in India’s National Statistical Commission, urging statutory authority, audits, and harmonisation to restore credibility and ensure reliable data for policymaking and public trust.

articles.title: India’s exports rise in first nine months of FY26, trade deficit widens beyond $25 billion
articles.summary: India’s exports grew 4.3% in April–December 2025 to $634.26 billion, led by smartphones and key markets, even as the trade deficit widened to over $25 billion.

articles.title: DEEP DIVE | Budget 2026: From housing to AI, industry flags execution gaps as the next growth challenge
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders urge policy clarity, faster approvals, and regulatory coherence for sustainable sector growth.

articles.title: India, EU target conclusion of FTA talks within two weeks: Commerce Ministry
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in the final leg of Free Trade Agreement talks, with 20 of 24 chapters closed and negotiations underway daily in virtual mode.

articles.title: India’s merchandise exports rise 1.86% in December, overall exports up 4.33% in first nine months
articles.summary: India’s merchandise exports rose to $38.51 billion in December 2025, with strong growth in electronic goods and marine products, and record overall exports of $215.7 billion in Q3 FY26.

articles.title: RBI proposes to tweak how banks compute FX risk exposure
articles.summary: Reserve Bank of India proposes new FX exposure rules for banks, aligning with global norms, effective April 1, 2027, and seeks feedback on calculation and capital requirements.

articles.title: China’s trade surplus surges to a record $1.2 trillion in 2025 despite Trump's tariff war
articles.summary: The disparity between China's robust manufacturing sector and persistently low domestic consumption is further highlighted by the growing surplus. The second-largest economy in the world has been driven by exports, but its long-term real estate recession and declining investment are limiting the nation's need for imported goods.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December
articles.summary: The Wholesale Price Index, or WPI, measures the change in prices of goods that wholesale businesses sell to and trade in bulk with other companies. Unlike the CPI, which tracks prices of goods and services purchased by consumers, WPI tracks factory gate prices before retail prices.

articles.title: Trade deal hopes can boost mood, but earnings matter more: BofA's Arbind Maheswari
articles.summary: BofA Securities’ Arbind Maheswari said progress in India-US trade talks could improve market sentiment, but long-term returns will depend on earnings growth. He expects about 14% earnings growth this year and a 12% Nifty return driven mainly by profits, with foreign outflows likely to ease and policy support helping the economy over time.

articles.title: Trump vs Supreme Court on tariffs: US President warns of ‘alternatives’ if policy is struck down
articles.summary: Donald Trump warned that an adverse ruling would have wide-ranging consequences, including the potential obligation to return “hundreds of billions” of dollars collected through tariffs. He also alleged that opposition to the tariffs was influenced by pro-China interests, arguing that resistance benefits Beijing. Read on:

articles.title: Jaishankar, Rubio discuss trade, critical minerals and energy amid India-US $500 billion trade push
articles.summary: The conversation comes as New Delhi and Washington attempt to rebuild momentum in bilateral economic engagement after stalled trade negotiations last year unsettled markets and pressured the rupee.

articles.title: Public insurers told to chase profits, younger customers and full digitalisation
articles.summary: DFS, led by M. Nagaraju, reviewed LIC, GIC, NIACL, NICL, UIICL, OICL and AICIL, focusing on profitability, digital onboarding, and customer reforms for FY 2024–25 and 2025–26.

articles.title: UPI user base can more than double to 1 billion: RBI Deputy Governor
